question: What is the rank of India in the ‘Social Mobility Index’, recently released by the World Economic Forum?
explanation:
In the recently released World Economic Forum’s Social Mobility Index, India was ranked at 76 out of 82 countries. Denmark was placed at the first rank in the inaugural edition of the index.
The index assessed the countries across five key dimensions, which are health, education, technology, work and protections& institutions and ten pillars distributed among the five dimensions. According to the index, the most socially mobile societies in the world are all European, the first five spots being held by Denmark, Norway, Finland, Sweden and Iceland.
